author: Allan Clarke
title: How A "Fuck You" To Australia Day Became An Ironic Anthem - BuzzFeed News
text:

ID: 10384140 According to one betting agency, the song is likely to make the final cut, however Flume‚Äôs Never Be Like You is favourite to take the top spot. Listening to the countdown at parties and barbecues has become an Australia Day tradition.
When voting for the Hottest 100 opened in December, A.B. Original asked fans to support January 26 . Facebook Post . facebook.com
ID: 10383911 ‚ÄúYou like irony and dope songs? Make A.B. Original with Dan Sultan January 26 number one!‚Äù Briggs tweeted.
Since voting opened, thousands of people have been posting their lists with A.B. Original included. Like Triple J hosts: Loading View on Instagram
Instagram: @domalessio
ID: 10391470 Famous Indigenous actors: Totally voted for @ABOriginalBAM track 'January 26' to win @triplej hottest üíØ! #ReclaimAustralia üòé
‚Äî Miranda Tapsell (@missmirandatap) ID: 10383635 Senior Australian politicians: 1/2 My @triplej #hottest100 vote: Tash Sultana Julia Jacklin A.B Original Alex the Astronaut Ball Park Music Bob Evans
‚Äî Tony Burke (@Tony_Burke) ID: 10391466 Comedians: Only one day left to vote for @triplej #Hottest100 can I recommend this one: https://t.co/EaCxXikCWj #January26 @ABOriginalBAM
‚Äî Wil Anderson (@Wil_Anderson) ID: 10383640 And heaps of punters: Voting for this catchy tune in the #Hottest100 is a practical way to get #changethedate on the national agenda. https://t.co/KuuT5lAunn
‚Äî Ruth Dearnley (@saidruth) ID: 10383814
every time i see a 'progressive' friend not vote for January 26 in the Hottest 100 i lose respect for them
‚Äî Harry Holbrook (@hazmatticus_) ID: 10383815 Vote A.B Original "January 26" for Hottest 100 - https://t.co/IBgvAq4ais
‚Äî Kim Flintoff (@kimbowa) ID: 10383822 Last September thousands of people, both Indigenous and non-indigenous, lobbied the radio station on social media to change the date of the Hottest 100, as January 26 is a day of mourning for Indigenous people.
‚ÄúThey play my music and I‚Äôm grateful every time they play my tunes, but I don‚Äôt partake in anything celebrating Australia Day,‚Äù rapper Nooky told BuzzFeed News last year. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs Invasion Day for me. Survival Day if I‚Äôm feeling nice.‚Äù
Triple J said it would not reschedule the 2017 countdown, but would reconsider future Hottest 100s.
‚ÄúBy voting for a song which is both an explanation and rejection of the idea of January 26 as a day of celebration‚Ä¶ we have the ability to send a message to Triple J. Let‚Äôs end the division and change the date,‚Äù wrote Simon Bags, the creator of a Facebook page encouraging people to vote for the track. View this image ‚Ä∫
ID: 10384174 Voting for the Hottest 100 closed on Monday.
